event_text: m_c is caught breaking the Warrior Code.
m_c went missing for a few days.
m_c believes they are part of a new prophecy.
m_c believes they're meant for something greater.
m_c tries to convince r_c to run away with them.
m_c is caught outside of the Clan's territory.
m_c skips back into camp with a pep in {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} step and a new flowery accessory!
r_c gives m_c something to adorn their pelt as congratulations.

r_c chirps softly at m_c as {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/walk/walks} over, and offers {PRONOUN/m_c/object} a pretty flower! m_c takes it and decorates {PRONOUN/m_c/self} with it, purring out a thank you.
m_c skips back into camp with a pep in {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} step and a new acc_singular accessory!

r_c chirps softly at m_c as {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/walk/walks} over, and offers {PRONOUN/m_c/object} a pretty acc_singular! m_c takes it and decorates {PRONOUN/m_c/self} with it, purring out a thank you.
m_c skips back into camp with a pep in {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} step and a new acc_singular accessory!

r_c chirps softly at m_c as {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/walk/walks} over, and offers {PRONOUN/m_c/object} a pretty acc_singular! m_c takes it and decorates {PRONOUN/m_c/self} with it, purring out a thank you.
m_c trudges around camp with {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} pelt somehow covered in muddy grime and moss. After being properly cleaned, m_c decides to keep the moss.
r_c, while m_c dozes off in camp, proceeds to pelt m_c with moss! m_c wakes up and snaps at r_c, but... keeps the moss on anyway. Strange.
m_c finds a cool stick near the edge of camp! m_c decides it's cool enough to keep around.

r_c finds a cool stick while on patrol! {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/bring/brings} it back home to m_c, and tells {PRONOUN/m_c/object} it's a gift! m_c accepts it happily, and decides to carry it around.
Mysteriously, it seems like m_c has found a small pumpkin near camp. m_c decides to roll it around along with {PRONOUN/m_c/object} around camp.

r_c finds a weird little pumpkin while on patrol! {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/bring/brings} it back home to m_c, and tells {PRONOUN/m_c/object} it's a gift! m_c accepts it happily, and decides to roll it around.
m_c tilts {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} head at the camp wall. Nobody's entirely sure why... until {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/pluck/plucks} a few ivy leaves off of the wall, and wear it with pride.

r_c finds a cool ivy-covered tree while on patrol! {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/bring/brings} a pair of pretty leaves back home to m_c, and tells {PRONOUN/m_c/object} it's a gift! m_c accepts it happily, and decides to wear it.
After m_c gets bonked on the head by a towering oak tree's falling acorns, {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/decide/decides} to take and wear one out of pure spite.
m_c spots an oak tree dropping acorns, and decided to take and wear one.

In the cool autumn air, m_c and r_c go on a short stroll together... and it's not too long until an acorn thunks onto the back of m_c's head. At r_c's cackles at {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} disgruntled, embarrassed face, {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/decide/decides} to take the acorn and wear it out of pure spite.
After a warm stroll in the leaf-broken sunlight, m_c comes back with moss in {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} jaws. {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/m_c/seem/seems} oddly possessive over it.

m_c and r_c decide to go on a warm, sunkissed stroll together to fetch some moss. m_c finds a specifically enamouring patch of moss, to r_c's amusement, and decides to bring it back home with {PRONOUN/m_c/object}.
m_c skips back into camp with a pep in {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} step... and with a new noodly, harmless friend!

r_c chirps softly at m_c as {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/walk/walks} over, and offers to show {PRONOUN/m_c/object} a cool, silly little acc_singular {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} found! m_c takes {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} invitation. After seeing the weird, harmless thing, m_c decides to take it home with {PRONOUN/m_c/object}.
m_c gently guides a acc_singular into camp. Seems like m_c has found a new friend?
r_c and m_c, on a walk together, stumble upon an acc_singular. m_c tilts {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} head, and decides to take it home! r_c is charmed by m_c's generosity.
m_c leaps up at a flying bug {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} found around camp, and catches it with grace! {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/m_c/wear/wears} the acc_plural proudly.
r_c mrrps at m_c, asking {PRONOUN/m_c/object} if {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} wanted a pair of acc_plural that {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} found. m_c says yes, and thanks {PRONOUN/r_c/object} for the cool wings!
m_c seems to have found a strange bug, and has decided to keep it as a pet.
r_c seems to have found a strange bug, and calls m_c over to see it. Curiously enough. m_c has decided to keep it as a pet.
m_c seems to have spotted acc_plural, and has decided to snag one up as a pet.
r_c seems to have found a pack of acc_singular collecting near a bush, and calls m_c over to see the acc_plural. Curiously enough. m_c has decided to keep one as a pet.
m_c tilts {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} head idly at a bee flying around {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} head. It doesn't seem to want to sting {PRONOUN/m_c/object}, so m_c assumes it wants to be {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} friend!
m_c wonders out on {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} own on a odd day, and comes back with a bee! m_c claims it's {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} new pet.

r_c and m_c decide to go for a short walk together! r_c calls from behind m_c, and m_c has to leap out of the way of a buzzing bee! m_c shifts to swipe at it... but r_c remarks that it seems oddly friendly. m_c decides to take it home with {PRONOUN/m_c/object}.
m_c comes into camp with a happy glint in {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} eye, happily sharing how m_c managed to keep a snail as {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} pet.
r_c and m_c go on a walk together! After a while, m_c and r_c run into a cute, slowly moving snail! m_c decides to keep it as a pet, and r_c cooes at the little thing as m_c carries it home.

r_c and m_c decide to go for a short walk together! r_c blinks in surprise, before pointing out a cool acc_singular bush {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} managed to spot! m_c tells r_c {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/have/has} a good eye, and decides to take and wear the acc_singular! r_c compliments {PRONOUN/r_c/object}, and m_c grins, flustered.

r_c and m_c decide to go for a short walk together! r_c blinks in surprise, before pointing out a cherry tree {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} managed to spot from a ways away! m_c tells r_c {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/have/has} a good eye, and decides to tread over and wear the acc_singular! r_c compliments {PRONOUN/r_c/object}, and m_c grins, flustered.
r_c gives m_c something to adorn m_c as congratulations.
r_c tells m_c that {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/have/has} been waiting for this day for ages... and prepared a pretty new accessory for them to wear.
m_c decides to pick something to adorn {PRONOUN/m_c/self} as celebration.
m_c found a mysterious acc_singular growing in the frost and decided to wear it.
m_c received a present, acc_plural, from r_c and decided to keep it with them on {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} pelt.
m_c was given acc_plural as a congratulations, r_c watches from the side with a jealous glint in {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} eyes.
m_c always seems to have acc_plural stuck in {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} fur.
m_c finds acc_plural while out on a walk and decides to keep them.
m_c received a present, two weaved leaves that form a cute green bow from r_c! m_c decides to keep it with {PRONOUN/m_c/object} on {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} pelt.

Over the past few days, m_c has been searching bushes with vigor. On an early morning, m_c reveals that {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/have/has} been braiding and weaving a bow made out of leaves for {PRONOUN/m_c/self}! m_c flaunts {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} work proudly.
m_c received a present, gently weaved acc_plural, from r_c and decided to keep it with {PRONOUN/m_c/object} on {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} pelt.

Over the past few days, m_c has been adamant on being near a nearby daisy patch. On an early morning, m_c reveals that {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/have/has} been braiding a daisy corsage for {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} tail! m_c flaunts {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} work proudly.

m_c proudly shows off something that {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/have/has} been working on for the past few days -- a clean, pristine white bird skull. {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} decide to wear it, and {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} do so proudly.

r_c proudly shows off something that {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/have/has} been working on for the past few days -- a clean, pristine white bird skull. m_c wears it with a purr, thanking them for the cool trinket.
m_c grins toothily at a acc_singular that wondered into camp! Instead of diving toward it like anyone would expect a cat to do, m_c decides to befriend it with seeds and nuts.

r_c's eyes dilate as {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/hunches/hunch} down to watch a mouse nibble at a fat seed! m_c stops r_c before {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} pounce, and manages to.. befriend the mouse! r_c rolls {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} eyes, grumbling about wasted food.

m_c proudly shows off something that {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/have/has} been working on for the past few days -- a perfectly crafted acc_singular! {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/m_c/decide/decides} to wear it, and {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} do so proudly.

r_c proudly shows off something that {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/have/has} been working on for the past few days -- a perfectly crafted acc_singular, made as a gift for m_c! {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/m_c/decide/decides} to wear it, purring softly.
r_c finds acc_plural while out on a walk and decides to give them to m_c.
m_c tossed a snake out of the camp before it could bite someone.
m_c tossed a snake out of the camp before it could bite r_c.
m_c misstepped and slipped from a rock, but landed on their feet before they could dislocate something.
m_c wasn't looking where they were going and tripped over a small trunk, but twisted themselves onto their back before they could sprain a leg.
m_c was trying to fluff up their nest when they saw a thorn inside of their bedding. Another prank, but it could not fool them!
m_c slipped on some rocks, but landed on their feet before they could dislocate something.
m_c gathered up the kits to tell them stories of story_list.
m_c spends the evening regaling the Clan with stories of story_list.
m_c and r_c begin a small camp snowball fight while on guard duty, eventually getting the whole Clan to join in.

r_c finds a patch of odd red orchids. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/decide/decides} to take a pair of it's prettiest blooms for a gift to give to m_c! m_c decorates {PRONOUN/m_c/self} with the pretty flowers, cooing softly at how pretty {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} feel with them on.

r_c finds a pretty, smelly field of onions with pretty pink blooms. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/take/takes} a few, and {VERB/r_c/gift/gifts} the stalks to m_c! m_c wears them all with a big sunny smile.
r_c gifted m_c bunches of pretty purple flowers! m_c wears them all with a big sunny smile.
m_c finds acc_singular! {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/m_c/wear/wears} the blooms with a smile.

m_c pokes around in the fresh kill pile. {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/m_c/manage/manages} to scavenge a whole bird skull! ...Gross! r_c helps {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} wash it and properly clean it before m_c wears it around camp.
m_c and r_c sneak out of camp to go bird watching. Seems like one of the birds decided to stick around m_c after {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} attempt to leave!
m_c sneaks out of camp to go bird watching. Seems like one of the birds decided to stick around m_c after {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} attempt to leave!
The tension between c_n and o_c is palpable, with even the smallest actions potentially leading to violence.
The war with o_c is beginning to disrupt the daily lives of c_n, forcing them to adapt to new routines and living situations in order to better defend themselves.
m_c and r_c watch the Clan's kits play and daydream about having their own one day.
